ggwrappers 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Kernel density plot wrapper for ggplot2

plot_density.Rd

Convenient wrapper around ggplot2::geom_density().

Usage

plot_density(
  data,
  x_str = NULL,
  fill_str = NULL,
  fill = "#6FBBE3",
  alpha = 0.4,
  ...
)

Arguments

data

Data frame to use for plot.

x_str

Character string. Name of variable in data to plot on x-axis. If NULL, plot density using all values in data frame.

fill_str

Character string. Name of variable in data to use as fill aesthetic in plot.

fill

Fill color. Only used if fill_str is NULL.

alpha

Alpha value for transparency.

...

Other arguments to pass to ggplot2::geom_density().

Value

A ggplot density.

Examples

## plot distribution of all data in data frame
plot_density(as.data.frame(rnorm(1000), nrow = 100))

## plot distribution of a single column in data frame
plot_density(iris, x_str = "Sepal.Width")

plot_density(iris, x_str = "Sepal.Width", fill_str = "Species")
